level.text: 2324.1 Section 101 Paragraph 3A of the Act (D.C. Official Code § 7-2501.01(3A)2013 Supp.)) defined the term “assault weapon” and § 202(a)(6) of the ActD.C. Official Code § 7-2502.02(a)(6) (2013 Supp.)) declared that an “assaulteapon” may not be registered in the District.

2324.2 In those instances where the definition of “assault weapon” referso a firearms manufacturer or description without including a specific modeleference, the term “assault weapon” shall be interpreted to include onlyhose firearms produced by such manufacturer, or possessing such description,hat share characteristics similar to the firearms enumerated in § 101aragraph 3A(A)(i)(I) through (III) of the Act (D.C. Official Code § 7-2501.013A)(A)(i)(I) through (III) (2013 Supp.)), or possess any of the enumeratedharacteristics listed in § 101 Paragraph 3A(A)(i)(IV) through (VIII) andA(A)(ii) through (iii) of the Act (D.C. Official Code §-2501.01(3A)(A)(i)(IV) through (VIII) and (3A)(A)(ii) through (iii) (2013upp.)).

2324.3 A firearm that is produced by a manufacturer or possesses a descriptionhat is included in the definition of “assault weapon” referred to in §324.1, but which does not share characteristics similar to the enumeratedirearms or the enumerated characteristics described in § 2324.2, may beegistered; provided, that the firearm is not otherwise prohibited fromegistration under District or Federal law or regulation.
